1{-# LANGUAGE RecordWildCards #-}
2{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
3
4-- | Parameter type.
5
6module Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Para.Para
7  ( -- * Parameter constructor
8    Para (..), ParaTag, ParaMap, ParaName,
9    para,
10    paraNameList,
11    paraNames, paraMultipleNames,
12    paraLookup, paraLookupSingle,
13    paraPosName,
14    paraNameAdd, paraNameMapKeys,
15    paraTakeFirst, paraTakeLast,
16
17    -- * Simple parameter
18    SimplePara, paraWords, paraHyphen,
19  ) where
20
21import qualified Data.Map.Strict                       as Ms
22import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture              as O
23import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base                  as B
24
25
26-- ----------------------  Parameter
27
28-- | Named and positional parameter.
29data Para n a
30    = Para
31      { paraTags  :: [ParaTag]      -- ^ Parameter tags.
32      , paraAll   :: [a]            -- ^ All parameter elements.
33      , paraPos   :: [a]            -- ^ Positional parameters.
34      , paraName  :: ParaMap n a    -- ^ Named parameters.
35      } deriving (Show, Eq, Ord)
36
37-- | Parameter tag.
38type ParaTag = String
39
40-- | Mapping parameter name to its contents.
41type ParaMap n a = Ms.Map n [[a]]
42
43-- | Empty parameter.
44instance B.Default (Para n a) where
45    def = Para { paraTags = []
46               , paraAll  = []
47               , paraPos  = []
48               , paraName = Ms.empty }
49
50instance (Ord n) => Monoid (Para n a) where
51    mempty        = B.def
52    mappend p1 p2 = Para { paraTags  = paraTags p1 ++  paraTags p2
53                         , paraAll   = paraAll  p1 ++  paraAll p2
54                         , paraPos   = paraPos  p1 ++  paraPos p2
55                         , paraName  = paraName p1 `u` paraName p2 }
56        where u = Ms.unionWith (++)
57
58-- | Test and take parameter name.
59type ParaName n a = a -> Maybe n
60
61-- | Parse list into parameter.
62--
63-- >>> para paraHyphen $ words "a b"
64-- Para { paraAll = ["a","b"], paraPos = ["a","b"], paraName = fromList [] }
65--
66-- >>> para paraHyphen $ words "a b -x c d"
67-- Para { paraAll = ["a","b","-x","c"]
68--      , paraPos = ["a","b"]
69--      , paraName = fromList [("x",[["c","d"]])] }
70--
71para :: (Ord n) => ParaName n a -> [a] -> Para n a
72para name xxs = pos xxs [] where
73    make ps            = B.def { paraAll = xxs, paraPos = reverse ps }
74    pos [] ps          = make ps
75    pos (x:xs) ps      = case name x of
76                          Nothing  -> pos xs (x:ps)
77                          Just n   -> let p = make ps
78                                          m = val Ms.empty n xs []
79                                      in p { paraName = Ms.map reverse m }
80    val a n []     vs  = add n vs a
81    val a n (x:xs) vs  = case name x of
82                           Nothing  -> val a n xs (x:vs)
83                           Just n2  -> let a2 = add n vs a
84                                       in val a2 n2 xs []
85    add n vs = paraInsert n $ reverse vs
86
87-- | Association list of named parameters.
88paraNameList :: Para n a -> [(n, [[a]])]
89paraNameList = Ms.assocs . paraName
90
91-- | List of parameter names.
92paraNames :: Para n a -> [n]
93paraNames = Ms.keys . paraName
94
95-- | List of names which appear more than once.
96paraMultipleNames :: Para n a -> [n]
97paraMultipleNames = paraNamesOf (not . B.isSingleton)
98
99paraNamesOf :: ([[a]] -> Bool) -> Para n a -> [n]
100paraNamesOf f = Ms.keys . Ms.filter f . paraName
101
102-- | Lookup named parameter.
103paraLookup :: (Ord n) => n -> Para n a -> Maybe [[a]]
104paraLookup n = Ms.lookup n . paraName
105
106-- | Lookup single-occurence parameter.
107paraLookupSingle :: (Ord n) => n -> Para n a -> Maybe [a]
108paraLookupSingle n p =
109    case paraLookup n p of
110      Just [vs]  -> Just vs
111      Just _     -> Nothing
112      Nothing    -> Nothing
113
114-- | Give names to positional parameters.
115paraPosName :: (Ord n, Monad m) => ([a] -> m [(n, [a])]) -> Para n a -> m (Para n a)
116paraPosName pn p =
117    do ns <- pn $ paraPos p
118       let m = Ms.fromList $ map (B.mapSnd B.list1) ns
119       return $ p { paraName = paraName p `Ms.union` m }
120
121-- | Add named parameter.
122paraNameAdd :: (Ord n) => n -> [a] -> O.Map (Para n a)
123paraNameAdd n vs p@Para { paraName = m } =
124    p { paraName = paraInsert n vs m }
125
126paraInsert :: (Ord n) => n -> [a] -> O.Map (ParaMap n a)
127paraInsert n a = Ms.insertWith (++) n [a]
128
129-- | Map names of named parameters.
130paraNameMapKeys :: (Ord n2) => (n1 -> n2) -> Para n1 a -> Para n2 a
131paraNameMapKeys f p@Para { paraName = m } =
132    p { paraName = Ms.mapKeys f m }
133
134-- | Take first element from multiply given named parameter.
135--
136--   >>> let p = para paraHyphen $ words "a -x 1 -x 2 -x 3"
137--   >>> p
138--   Para { ..., paraName = fromList [("x", [["1"],["2"],["3"]])] }
139--   >>> paraTakeFirst "x" p
140--   Para { ..., paraName = fromList [("x", [["1"]])] }
141--
142paraTakeFirst :: (Ord n) => n -> Para n a -> Para n a
143paraTakeFirst = paraAdjustName B.takeFirst
144
145-- | Take last element from multiply given named parameter.
146paraTakeLast :: (Ord n) => n -> Para n a -> Para n a
147paraTakeLast = paraAdjustName B.takeLast
148
149paraAdjustName :: (Ord n) => ([[a]] -> [[a]]) -> n -> Para n a -> Para n a
150paraAdjustName f n p@Para {..} = p { paraName = Ms.adjust f n paraName }
151
152
153-- --------------------------------------------  Simple
154
155-- | String-named parameter.
156type SimplePara a = Para String a
157
158-- | Composition of word separation and parameter parsing.
159paraWords :: (Ord n) => ParaName n String -> String -> Para n String
160paraWords name = para name . words
161
162-- | Parameter name is beginning with hyphen.
163--
164-- >>> paraHyphen "-foo"
165-- Just "foo"
166--
167-- >>> paraHyphen "bar"
168-- Nothing
169paraHyphen :: ParaName String String
170paraHyphen ('-' : n)  = Just n
171paraHyphen _          = Nothing
172
